programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: An aspiring martial-arts fighter tries to wriggle out of handcuffs and gets stuck. A football rivalry takes a bad turn when a Steelers fan assaults a Ravens fan.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: Guards uncover grooming aids stashed in an unlikely spot while combing through a woman's things. An incarcerated tourist threatens to bring in Johnny Cochran for his defense, and a drunk driver awakens to find X-rated artwork drawn on his body.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: In Sarasota, FL a man is busted for an open container of beer. In Salt Lake City, UT a woman is stunned as to how drug paraphernalia wound up on her person. In Las Vegas, NV a former bus driver relays sad details about his past. In Portland, OR a shoplifter receives some sage of wisdom from one of the officers.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A woman comes clean to having drugs hidden where they can’t be seen. An inmate’s exotic makeup is cleverly created with candy and toothpaste. A couple is surprised to find that holding someone against their will is a felony. Doing the right thing turns into an extended stay for a woman with warrants.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: In Las Vegas, NV an honest offender turns himself in. Officers arrest an underage woman who admits to driving under the influence. A woman is taken into custody after harming herself with a pair of scissors

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: An uncooperative inmate complicates things. A man charged with DUI complains about the prison food. A security guard arrested for robbery fears that her dream job with Homeland Security is gone.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A man claims royal lineage during a combative booking process. After resisting officers and harboring a vicious animal, a man is arrested. Later, intoxicated individuals create havoc for officers.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A man is charged with possession of an illegal substance. Police arrest a woman for narcotics, and a couple is caught passing a fake prescription.

programme.title: Jail
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Crack Pipe on Phone Wall
programme.desc: Chaos surrounds a routine medical screening of an inmate. In the prison phone center, a smoking pipe is discovered and a mystery ensues. A pregnant woman is investigated over potential sex crimes.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: In Portland, OR a man in custody accuses officers of being involved in the 1992 event at Ruby Ridge. In Sarasota, FL a drunk man falls off his bike and purports to have been hit by a car. In Las Vegas, LV a daring inmate attempts to make a break for it while the supervising officers attend to a disturbance.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: Deputies deal with chaos after volatile inmates begin fighting. Accusations of deceit plague a booking as a woman is arrested for drunk driving. Prisoners are restrained after causing a commotion.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: In Salt Lake City, UT officers break up an altercation between two inmates. In Portland, OR a belligerent man questions the authorities. In Sarasota, FL a man is busted for DUI. In Las Vegas, NV a woman is taken into custody for battery.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: An inmate is subdued for refusing to follow commands. A woman accused of running out on a dinner bill has her jewelry sawed off in jail. After issuing criminal terrorist threats, a man is jailed.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A violent ruckus ensues after a man is placed in jail. Secret prison communication methods are explored and examined. Later, deputies cautiously extract a disruptive man while his wife is held nearby.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: In San Diego, CA an officer grapples with a combative detainee. In Portland, OR six party goers are taken into custody. In Fort Worth, TX a high-risk inmate manages to get the key to his handcuffs.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A defiant suspect’s behavior takes a turn for the worse after being placed in the restraining chair. A spit mask wearing suspect attempts to procure enhancing supplements from a jail nurse. An intoxicated male suspect swoons for a certain female officer. A local vagrant is taken into custody after attempting to retrieve some things from his ex wife’s house.

programme.title: Jail
programme.sub-title: S05 : E04 Sunshine on a Cloudy Day
programme.desc: A woman who says she’s called “Sunshine” has less than a sunny disposition. A man ditches a halfway house for jail to get his life in order. A career criminal shows no regret for his “thug life.” Tense moments in Booking as officers and medical staff try to save a young man from a drug overdose.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A strip search reveals a male inmate in women's lingerie. A couple of puppy thieves get amorous in the bathroom, and a pregnant woman is arrested for solicitation.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: Headbutts and aggression abound during a jail fight. A young man is arrested after stealing $1,500 worth of hats. Officers discover a suicidal inmate who’s no longer taking his medication.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: In his holding cell, a man fights officers after taking Xanax. An officer discovers a suspect may be facing criminal charges for his son. K-9 units are needed during a search for improvised weapons.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: To avoid self-harm, an intoxicated man is handcuffed to a booking bench. After fighting at a bar, a combative prisoner is arrested. Also, an unmarried couple squabbles during the booking process.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: In Salt Lake City, UT an inebriated man gets aggressive and questions why he's in custody. In Sarasota, FL a couple are taken in for assaulting a bartender. In Portland, OR a man is placed in custody for harassing movie theater security guards. In Las Vegas, NV a chauffeur is placed in custody for amassing a number of of moving violations.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A man is arrested at a popular theme park for public intoxication. A detainee swallows his earring during processing. Officers attempt to restrain a combative woman in custody.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: An uncooperative woman is placed in a restraint chair. A troubled woman with a drug addiction is brought in on prostitution charges. One man is taken to a sobering cell to sleep off his intoxication.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A testy man is sent to the isolation cell to "cool off." A teary-eyed young man maintains his innocence. An inmate may have ingested contraband to avoid possession charges.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A prisoner refuses to exit his cell prompting an elaborate extraction. A man begins singing in response to his arrest. During a severe alcohol withdrawal, an inmate repeatedly escapes his restraints.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A man in detention is paranoid about officers handling him inappropriately. A man in custody claims to have a seizure. A man is taken in to custody for stealing videogaming equipment.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A dominatrix is arrested for playing rough. A father is accused of assaulting his daughter's boyfriend, and an inmate's negative attitude leads to trouble.

programme.title: Jail
programme.desc: A man brought in for trespassing becomes violent. A sex worker admits she۪s witholding her pediculosis condition from clients. A woman explains her tattoos are a reminder of the women she loved.

programme.sub-title: S05 : E07 Old Habits Die Hard
programme.desc: An inmate demands that officers follow her instructions while in jail. A man insists that he has been kidnapped by the police and is being held illegally. programme.sub-title: S24 : E11 A Song of Fire and Cleaning
programme.desc: The pursuit of a criminal driver ends in a fire and police rescue. Police track down an elusive suspect. A family dispute over cleaning a garage ends with the police being called.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A drunk man threatens both firefighters and the police. Police are called over a dispute regarding an alleged missing dog. A drunk driver changes his story when his friend is found pinned under his car.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A woman bites the arresting officer and store manager after trying to steal beer. A passenger of a suspicious vehicle attempts to hide drugs. Police respond to a call involving a knife and two women.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S15 : E28 Bad Fences make for Bad Neighbors
programme.desc: Officers are involved in a high-speed pursuit of suspected larcenists. Officers give a driver a sobriety test. Officers report to a call of a dispute in a neighborhood.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Deputies pursue a truck with a trailer full of golf carts. Police question a driver after finding a mask and handgun in his car. Officers are called to a traffic collision involving a semi and an SUV.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A DUI suspect with a suspended license claims he’s not drunk. Officers track an armed robber. An armed and dangerous suspect hides from Officers in an apartment complex.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A dangerous pursuit between Officers and a known meth dealer ends in an arrest. A suspect with several felony warrants is apprehended without incident. A pursuit involving a stolen motorcycle exceeds speed of 100mph.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspicious driver takes police on a neighborhood chase. Officers are called to capture a 12-foot python hiding outside a home. Officers suspect a funny walking motorist is hiding something in his shoe.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A vehicular pursuit in Florida comes to a head when the driver careens into a ditch. An officer responds to a troubling domestic call. An intoxicated brawler is taken into custody.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A disastrous carjacking results in an arrest. Officers respond to a domestic abuse call involving two women. Officers find drug paraphernalia on a suspicious man parked in the middle of the street.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S23 : E21 Don't Make her Angry
programme.desc: A man needs police assistance when his angry ex-girlfriend crawls through his window. Police must play hide-and-seek when they attempt to execute an arrest warrant. A man is threatened with violence when he refuses to turn his car’s headlights off.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S22 : E31 When Ya Gotta Go
programme.desc: A man urinating in public flees from police on foot. A handgun is found in the vehicle of a driver who claims to be a student leaving class. Deputies find drugs in a man’s car when he runs a stop sign.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S19 : E05 Tuck and Roll, Hold On!
programme.desc: A stolen vehicle investigation results in a brief foot chase and subsequent arrest. A driver is pulled over and is arrested for the possession of a controlled substance. While on patrol an officer spots an distressed man inside a vehicle with busted windows.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S27 : E28 Tell it to My Wife
programme.desc: A man’s wife can’t help him stay out of jail no matter how much he calls for her. One thief tries to give back his stolen loot. When approached by officers, a woman goes from passed out to out of control.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A chase ends when a driver-less vehicle goes headfirst into an apartment complex. A swift suspect can’t scamper fast enough to evade police. On routine patrol, officers stumble upon a 7-year-old boy who left home alone.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers enlist the help of a K-9 unit after suspects in a dangerous high-speed chase abandon their car in a residential area. A woman with visible injuries tells the Officer that her husband assaulted her after they left a drive-in. A woman sprays her boyfriend with mace when she sees him with another woman.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S16 : E29 The Last Home Invasion
programme.desc: Police investigate an attempted robbery that turned deadly. Officers enlist a K9 unit to flush out a suspect. A high-speed chase comes to an end when the suspect crashes into a fence.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Detectives chase a suspect who wrecks his car. Police are called when a man headbutts his neighbor. Officers tend to a woman punched in the face by her husband while on the bus.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers assist a bondsman after a fugitive and his girlfriend refuse to surrender. An officer pulls over a teen who attempts to ingest a bag of marijuana while the officer isn’t looking. An officer makes an arrest after the female suspect has an outstanding warrant.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers are dispatched to an apartment complex where a young girl may have been a victim of a sexual assault. An officer spots a speeding motorcycle and attempts a routine stop.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A prostitute tries to outrun the police during a foot chase. A man claims he can only meet women at motels since he lives with his mom. A prostitute fresh out of jail protests that he’s not trying to return to his old career.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S21 : E25 Hide and Go Porch
programme.desc: Officers engage in a car chase when they spot a possible robbery suspect. A man nicknamed “Danger” is tasered after assaulting several girls. Suspects bail from a vehicle and hide under a porch.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers are flagged down and alerted to a group of armed men assaulting people at a nearby home. A fight between a father and his adult son takes a dark turn. A father threatens his daughter and her boyfriend with a knife.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers recover a small bag of drugs from a crying suspect. A drunk woman hides a second ID in her back pocket. Police stop a vehicle that hit a patrol car.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers coax a man off a large construction crane. An inebriated man is jailed for domestic abuse. A man is rescued from a flash flood, but his truck isn’t so lucky.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S26 : E19 You Didn't Get Very Far
programme.desc: A husky cyclist takes a spill when he tries to flee. Officers chase a suspect in a stolen car who says he was just fixing it for a friend. A man's denials of drug use lose credibility when cops find a meth pipe in his vehicle

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect bites an Officer while trying to avoid arrest. An Officer responds to a stabbing. An Officer is flagged down by a concerned group looking for a missing 4-year-old.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Three men are apprehended for solicitation. Officers respond to a domestic violence call at an apartment complex. An officer discovers a teenager is dating an older man.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S13 : E17 Give Me My Money
programme.desc: A reckless driver claims he wants to kill himself. A woman steals $1,700 from a man trying to buy drugs. Police arrest a man for drinking a driving.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S23 : E01 Ignorance is an Excuse
programme.desc: Two men engage in a fist fight on the street over an alleged robbery. A couple claims that they didn’t know the car they are driving is stolen. Occupants of a vehicle claim that all of the contraband found in their car is medical equipment.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A jaywalker with no ID bolts away from an officer. A man mixes illicit items with his pizza. A woman involved in a domestic violence call blames her monthly issues.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect flees police in a truck over a misdemeanor traffic warrant. A man denies hitting his wife who has a bloody nose. A man denies ownership of his shorts when deputies find drugs in them.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Deputies respond to a fight between a daughter’s boyfriend and her mother. A woman lights candles after an attempted break-in. Police respond when an evicted tenant tries to reenter his old apartment.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A drunk driver rams into a pursuing police car. A man on a bike flees an area known for drug activity on a bike. A sniffling man attempts to hide a baggie with narcotics under his shirt.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A DUI suspect reminds an officer of one famous dude. A naked man shocks a stranger on her porch. A daughter’s tantrum shakes the whole apartment when mom takes away Facebook.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A repeat offender in Las Vegas attempts an ambitious vertical escape. An officer investigates a domestic call involving an armed male suspect. A driver concealing drugs in his mouth eventually swallows the crack cocaine, but comes clean about his possession.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Witnesses of a car burglary assist an officer in locating the suspect. An officer investigates a fight involving a young man and a homeless gentleman. A suspect’s testimony is debunked after an eyewitness confirms that his knife wounds were self-inflicted.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S15 : E22 Barked Up The Wrong Tree
programme.desc: Following a brief slow-speed pursuit, the desperate driver flees on foot. An officer responds to an assault. A dog owner is informed of her dog's mayhem and given a citation.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An Officer spots a gun in a vehicle during a routine traffic stop, but the passengers are denying ownership. An intoxicated woman assaults her step-father with a butter knife after he refuses to take her to the hospital for spider bites. A man denies vandalizing a building even though there's evidence on his fingers.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers search for a runaway suspect with a weapons charge. A man admits to having a large number of drugs during a traffic stop. Officers respond to a man with a gun in an alley.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers pursue a male suspect in a speeding truck and ultimately force the vehicle off the road, the suspect is taken into custody without injury. Officers respond to a domestic abuse call. Officers are called to a home where a dead body is found.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man wearing women’s underwear exposes himself to a couple and the incident is caught on tape. Officers question a naked man in the backseat of a vehicle who claims to be camping.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S26 : E22 Dealt A Bad Hand
programme.desc: Multiple suspects spill out in a mad scramble when their vehicle flips over in a pursuit. A distraught man complains that a stranger tried to lasso him with a metal necklace. A driver has trouble staying in his lane after a lousy night of poker.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers wrestle an uncooperative driver to the ground after a traffic stop. Deputies search for a man who sent threatening texts to his ex-girlfriend. Two suspects are caught stealing gas.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S15 : E35 Crooked as a Fish Hook
programme.desc: A reverse drug operation proves successful for officers in both Tampa, FL and Palm Beach County, FL. Officers are in search of a suspect responsible for burglary.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers break up a fight between a couple in the middle of the street. Not even a church is immune to being robbed. A dispute between neighbors involves deadly weapons.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect flees as officers respond to a fight call. A belligerent meth user refuses to cooperate after being pulled over. A cranky husband gets busted for pot after his wife kicks over his Harley.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect bails out of his vehicle when a car chase reaches a dead-end. An officer responds to a domestic disturbance call and recommends that the quarreling couple get a divorce. Officers investigate a suspected drug transaction.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An officer assists with a burglary call at a mall jeweler. An officer responds to a domestic dispute call involving two newlyweds at a Las Vegas motel. An accident occurs during a routine traffic stop.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S14 : E02 Pain in the Neck
programme.desc: Deputies confront a man holding a knife to his roommate’s neck over a prior argument. A suspect runs from Deputies on a warrant charge. Suspected robbers are pulled over by Deputies.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S25 : E10 If You Hear Hooves
programme.desc: A woman needs police help when her boyfriend threatens her with a knife. A zebra runs loose on the streets of Sacramento County. A man wants to use a stick and a rock to settle a dispute.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man with a knife tries to evade police by hiding in bushes. Vice Unit Officers conduct a prostitution sting. When Officers are shot at during a pursuit, the woman claims it was flashes from a camera.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Deputies search a suspicious vehicle behind a strip club. A man threatens to shoot employees at a car rental company. A man tosses lip balm filled with narcotics out the window during a traffic stop.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Teens are arrested after authorities find an open container and drugs inside a vehicle. A suspect is arrested after fleeing the police. Officers respond to a fight involving two men and a shovel.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: US Marshals are tasked with finding a young boy that has been kidnapped for ransom. A man suspected of dealing contraband is reported by his ex-girlfriends mother. Officers raid a home looking for a dangerous fugitive.

programme.desc: 80 singalong classics from the ultimate decade of Karaoke - the 80s! Every one designed to blast out loud in the sunshine.

programme.title: Every Song From NOW 3 - 1984
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Every Song From NOW 3 - 1984
programme.desc: NOW 3 featured plenty of smash hits, but also plenty of long forgotten songs from the likes of Blancmange, David Sylvian & The Art Company. Every video we could find is here!

programme.title: 1984 Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dramatic storylines, big dance routines, neon lights & iconic fashions - these are the classic music videos that made 1984!

programme.title: Bonnie Tyler's Greatest Hits!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Bonnie Tyler's Greatest Hits!
programme.desc: The timeless songs from Bonnie's power period - 1976 to 1985. Includes 'Total Eclipse'!

programme.title: Long Hot Summer!
programme.desc: All 80s - 24/7 - the feelgood pop decade where the Brits invaded the world!

programme.title: Karaoke For Your Kids! Top 25
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Karaoke For Your Kids! Top 25
programme.desc: Singalong hits with the ultimate in dead catchy choruses. From Mickey & Tarzan Boy to Walk The Dinosaur & House of Fun.

programme.title: Great Song - Stupid Title! 1980-89
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Great Song - Stupid Title! 1980-89
programme.desc: Robin Banks with 25 amazing songs, 25 nonsense titles - in order from 1980-1989. Fancy Dinner With Gershwin or a Walk with the Dinosaur? This is where to come!

programme.title: Long Hot Summer!
programme.desc: All 80s - 24/7 - the feelgood pop decade where the Brits invaded the world!

programme.title: The Ultimate Duets! 1980-1989
programme.desc: 100 acts, but only 50 songs - it must be 80s duets! Including Diana & Lionel, Aretha & George, Peter & Kate, Cliff & Sarah, Patti & Michael, and not forgetting Shaky & Bonnie!

programme.title: Monday Night at the Movies!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Monday Night at the Movies!
programme.desc: Popcorn at the ready, these are NOW 80s' biggest songs from the movies. But don't forget to switch off those mobile phones!

programme.title: Carol Decker's 30 Rock Dudes!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Carol Decker's 30 Rock Dudes!
programme.desc: T'Pau's Carol Decker is back again with a countdown of 80s guys who liked to rock! With John Parr, Billy Idol, Guns n Roses & ZZ Top.

programme.title: Soft Rock & Power Pop!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Soft Rock & Power Pop!
programme.desc: From the decade that invented the genre - non-stop powerful love songs, back to back.

programme.title: Complete George Michael: 1982-1989
programme.desc: A complete video retrospective of George's 80s hits - both solo & with Wham, Elton John, Aretha Franklin & that forgotten top 10 from Boogie Box High.

programme.title: The Rock 100 of the 70s
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Rock 100 of the 70s
programme.desc: Mark Goodier brings you our exclusive chart of the 100 biggest rock songs of the 70s, based on streaming data, historic sales info, and enduring global appeal. Crank this up LOUD!

programme.title: Flares & Floorfillers! 1970-1979
programme.desc: Mmm, sniff that heady waft of Brut mixed with cheap perfume as you hit a dancefloor for our playlist of top bops in your cheesecloth shirt or nylon blouse. Make mine a Babycham!

programme.title: In The Summertime!
programme.desc: Feelgood sunshine hits from a colourful decade - the 1970s! Flares & mini-skirts at the ready?

programme.title: The 50s Revival! Top 25
programme.desc: They say music goes in cycles - well for a period in the 70s we decided to celebrate all things 50s! Showaddywaddy's Dave Bartram has hits from Alvin Stardust, Mud, Darts & Grease!

programme.title: In The Summertime!
programme.desc: Feelgood sunshine hits from a colourful decade - the 1970s! Flares & mini-skirts at the ready?

programme.title: 50 Summer Sizzlers! 1970-1979
programme.desc: 50 of the very best feel-good summer hits. Each was a Top 10 smash across June, July & August in the '70s - on the beach, on your transistor radio, and at the big Radio 1 Roadshow!

programme.title: In The Summertime!
programme.desc: Feelgood sunshine hits from a colourful decade - the 1970s! Flares & mini-skirts at the ready?

programme.title: Simon Bates 70s Pop Reloaded!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Simon Bates 70s Pop Reloaded!
programme.desc: The ever-smooth Simes dusts off his flares, fires up the lava lamp & takes you on a psychedelic spin through the 70s. Side effects may include sudden urges to perm your hair!

programme.title: Saturday Night's Alright!
programme.desc: From the era of Glam Rock, New Wave & Disco - it's all the party hits from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Platform boots & flares at the ready?

programme.title: Pat Sharp's Karaoke Party!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Pat Sharp's Karaoke Party!
programme.desc: Come prepared, as those vocal chords are going to see a lot of action as we spend 3 nostalgic hours with Pat Sharp's 70s house party. All gatecrashers welcome!

programme.title: Saturday Night's Alright!
programme.desc: From the era of Glam Rock, New Wave & Disco - it's all the party hits from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Platform boots & flares at the ready?

programme.title: 25 Disco Divas!
programme.desc: The ladies of disco - but who's going to be our number 1? With Tina Charles, Sheila B, The Emotions, Baccara, Gloria Gaynor & Abba.

programme.title: 1978 Unleashed!
programme.desc: Classic hits from just 1 year - 1978!

programme.title: 50 Summer Sizzlers! 1970-1979
programme.desc: 50 of the very best feel-good summer hits. Each was a Top 10 smash across June, July & August in the '70s - on the beach, on your transistor radio, and at the big Radio 1 Roadshow!

programme.title: In The Summertime!
programme.desc: Feelgood sunshine hits from a colourful decade - the 1970s! Flares & mini-skirts at the ready?

programme.title: Simon Bates 70s Pop Reloaded!

programme.desc: The ever-smooth Simes dusts off his flares, fires up the lava lamp & takes you on a psychedelic spin through the 70s. Side effects may include sudden urges to perm your hair!

programme.title: Saturday Night's Alright!
programme.desc: From the era of Glam Rock, New Wave & Disco - it's all the party hits from just 1 decade - the 1970s! Platform boots & flares at the ready?

programme.title: Around The World! 1970-1979
programme.desc: From the Top Of The World to Argentina, via Bangor, Babylon, Barbados, Cuba, Copacabana & Hong Kong - this is our wander round the world in song titles!

programme.title: Party Hits '76! with Dave Bartram
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Party Hits '76! with Dave Bartram
programme.desc: Every song comes from that vintage year when the sun shone all summer & Dave's band Showaddywaddy had their big number 1. Queen, Leo Sayer, Abba & Smokie also kept the hits coming.

programme.title: 1976 Unleashed!
programme.desc: Classic hits from just 1 year - 1976!

programme.title: Tony's 25 Biggest Pop Groups!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Tony's 25 Biggest Pop Groups!
programme.desc: Pop Groups ruled the 70s & came from all quarters! From Germany's Boney M, Sweden's Abba & the UK's Queen, Police & Showaddywaddy - Tony Blackburn counts down the definitive 25.

programme.title: Country Crossovers! 1970-1979
programme.desc: Through the 70s Country Music threw up regular UK chart smashes - from Anne Murray & Johnny Cash in 1970 to Dr Hook & Kenny Rogers at the end of the decade. And yes there's Dolly!

programme.title: In The Summertime!
programme.desc: Feelgood sunshine hits from a colourful decade - the 1970s! Flares & mini-skirts at the ready?

programme.title: Hamilton's Million Sellers! 70-79
programme.desc: David Hamilton with 30 famous songs, 3 from every year. Each was a million selling single or from a million selling album, either in the UK or around the world!

programme.title: 1975 Unleashed!
programme.desc: Classic hits from just 1 year - 1975!

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac! 1975-1989
programme.desc: Ignore the grainy visuals - just sit back and enjoy Fleetwood Mac in their late 70s & 80s pomp! 11 classic songs, in order, through Rumours, Tusk & Tango In The Night.

programme.title: Retro Rewind! 70s Edition
programme.desc: From hippies to punk rockers, via folk, funk, soul & disco - these are the classic songs that made the 70s!

programme.title: We Are Family! Top 20
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 We Are Family! Top 20
programme.desc: Brothers, sisters, husbands and wives - we'll keep it in the family with 90 mins of top tunes from The Bee Gees, Abba, The Osmonds, The Nolans and others, all on the way!

programme.title: Retro Rewind! 70s Edition
programme.desc: From hippies to punk rockers, via folk, funk, soul & disco - these are the classic songs that made the 70s!

programme.title: Really? Only 1 Week At No.1?
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Really? Only 1 Week At No.1?
programme.desc: The pop nerds at NOW 70s have been into the archives and pulled out 2 hours of amazing no.1s that only spent a single week on top! Big names include Kenny Rogers, The Quo & 10cc.

programme.title: Non-Stop 70s Number 1s!
programme.desc: A choice selection of the 168 singles that reached the top of the UK charts in the 1970s!

programme.title: 70s v 80s Rock Legends!
programme.desc: 30 hit songs, 15 top rock legends - one track as they were in the 70s, and another in the 80s - simple!

programme.title: We Will Rock You!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 We Will Rock You!
programme.desc: Non-stop 70s rock & guitar anthems! A classic decade for Queen, Status Quo, Led Zepp, Black Sabbath, The Stones & Thin Lizzy.

programme.title: One Hit Wonders! 1970-1979
programme.desc: They all had 1 massive song, then never skirted the UK Top 20 singles chart again! Here are 70 acts from every year of the 70s, in order, who all achieved their 15 minutes of fame.

programme.title: In The Summertime!
programme.desc: Feelgood sunshine hits from a colourful decade - the 1970s! Flares & mini-skirts at the ready?

programme.title: Rick Wakeman's WILD Things!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Rick Wakeman's WILD Things!
programme.desc: Remember when rock was WILD? From '64 to '74 the pioneering heroes presented by a man who was at the centre of it all - from The Kinks to The Beatles to Black Sabbath to Queen!

programme.title: We Will Rock You!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 We Will Rock You!
programme.desc: Non-stop 70s rock & guitar anthems! A classic decade for Queen, Status Quo, Led Zepp, Black Sabbath, The Stones & Thin Lizzy.

programme.title: Killer Queen! 1974-1979
programme.desc: Along with Abba, Elton John & Rod Stewart - Queen dominated the 70s and like them continue to resonate today! The songs are magnificent, and the videos are quite good too!

programme.title: Bowie v Bolan! 1970-1974
programme.desc: Cool icons of 70s glam go into battle! But who can be the most outrageous?

programme.title: The 1971 POWER Hour with Bam!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The 1971 POWER Hour with Bam!
programme.desc: Seventies music power to play loud! Work out your speakers with some pure power pop and rock including Cher, Slade, and the Stones!

programme.desc: From disco to glam pop to stadium rock, these are 50 songs with 100% energy - every single one is a hell raiser!

programme.title: Dumplings, Steam Buns, and Dim Sum, Oh My!
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: In Hong Kong, one brother will live like a king, while the other will check out the city’s street food scene.

programme.title: Simplicity vs. Splendor on the Seaside
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Soaking in the beauty and elegance of the French Riviera, Marko and Alex are in Nice to enjoy the simplicity and splendor of this seaside city.

programme.title: Keep Austin Weird
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: In the state capital of Texas, Marko and Alex see what Austin has to offer. An eclectic city known for its music and cuisine, the guys brave the Texas heat and check out what keeps Austin weird.

programme.title: Levels of Luxury in Laos
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Sandwiched between Thailand, Vietnam, and Cambodia, Laos is a destination often overlooked by tourists. Marko and Alex are uncovering the hidden gem of Vientiane, the capital city, to see what goes on in this sleepy town beside the Mekong River.

programme.title: The Gainful Grace of Geneva
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Marko and Alex find themselves in the prosperous and pristine city of Geneva, Switzerland. A city nestled alongside a beautiful glacier-fed lake, the guys will explore the riches Geneva has to offer.

programme.title: The Thriving Traditions of Taipei
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Welcome to the buzzing capital of Taiwan. A rich blend of cultures, old meets new in this thriving metropolis of Taipei. Marko and Alex eat their way through the city, experiencing some unique traditions along the way.

programme.title: The Lion's Share of Lyon
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Marko and Alex head to Lyon, France, a city known for its gastronomy and endless history.

programme.title: Oceanside in Okinawa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Ocean breeze, turquoise waters and a whole lot of amazing cuisine. Marko and Alex are soaking up that island life in Okinawa, Japan and learning what makes it so unique.

programme.title: Genoa From Above and Below
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: In Genoa, the brothers cruise the streets, while one of them gets a taste for the lavish lifestyle of Italy's Northwestern port. They take in all the views: heads in the clouds on a high-flying funicular, and just above water at the local aquarium.

programme.title: The L.A. Lifestyle
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Basic Versus Baller: Travel at Any Cost
programme.desc: Green juice, avocado toast, and surfers galore. Marko and Alex are back home in Los Angeles to explore their town, staycation style. From downtown to the beach, the guys do everything fun under the sun in the city of angels.

programme.desc: Alex is in Vancouver Island and calls for Saffron salmon at Modern Cafe. Next he visits “Red fish blue fish” a fish and chip shop and tries freshly prepared seafood. Further explores the Parksville beach for its sand sculptures and then explores a 50 year old Symphony Winery. Further Alex visits “Eagle wing whale watching” for fun and knowledge about the ocean life. To add to the adventure rush he tries motocross and then snorkels in cold waters of Nanaimo.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Food Fact Fun Whistler, Canada
programme.desc: Alex starts with Kangaroo meat pie in Whistler with a Australian ginger beer and continuing his food trail he visits Earls kitchen for a tuna dish. He then tries out e-biking and travels in the world’s highest cable car joining Blackcomb with Whistler mountain. Next, he visits Squamish lil’wat cultural center to learn about the Aboriginal people. Finally, he takes a tour of Pemberton valley on a horse, tries Canada’s highest zipline and bungee jumps over the Cheakamus river.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: Kissed By The Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Kissed By The Sea Mauritius 1
programme.desc: Blessed with coral reefs, sapphire waters and powder-white beaches, Mauritius is the kind of place that rewards even the smallest attempts at exploration. Renowned adventurer, Sakshi Pradhan finds herself in an old lighthouse on Fouquet Island and then stumbles upon the Junk Café. From snorkeling in sapphire waters to taking a walk with lions in Casela National Park, she comes across various adventures in Mauritius, which make her feel alive.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels One & Only Reethi Rah 2
programme.desc: Located in the North Malé Atoll of Maldives, the Reethi Rah resort is the perfect combination of island life mixed with world-class luxury.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Viajar Mexico S2 Pátzcuaro
programme.desc: Charlie Rubio visits one of the many ‘indigenous paradises’ across Mexico, where he gets a chance to visit a hidden heron sanctuary on an island.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Food Fact Fun Niagara, Canada
programme.desc: Alex starts in Niagara with a 5 course meal along with enjoying dance performances near the Niagara falls. Next, exploring the urban space, he visits the Skylon town for a stunning view of the city. Further he visits the Niagara-on-the-lake village and explores its surroundings. He then interacts with a wine expert to learn more about the regional wines. Lastly, Alex is seen exploring the Niagara falls by helicopter, the a tunnel that takes him to the observation desk and then by ferry.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: Like Rome, Plovdiv straddles seven hills; but as Europe’s oldest continuously inhabited city, it’s far more ancient. As Catriona takes a tour of the city to see its iconic attractions such as a Roman Amphitheatre, which was once the setting for gladiator fights, and the striking Baroque Saints Constantine and Helena Church, she begins to see how seamlessly modern life blends with the age-old ruins. Along the way, she realizes why Plovdiv is called the ‘Eternal City’ of Bulgaria.

programme.title: Kissed By The Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Kissed By The Sea Mauritius 1
programme.desc: Blessed with coral reefs, sapphire waters and powder-white beaches, Mauritius is the kind of place that rewards even the smallest attempts at exploration. Renowned adventurer, Sakshi Pradhan finds herself in an old lighthouse on Fouquet Island and then stumbles upon the Junk Café. From snorkeling in sapphire waters to taking a walk with lions in Casela National Park, she comes across various adventures in Mauritius, which make her feel alive.

programme.title: The Savvy Nomad
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Savvy Nomad Koh Tao, Thailand (ENG)
programme.desc: Emeline visits Koh Tao - a small island in the Gulf of Thailand often referred to as a ‘diver’s paradise’.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels One & Only Reethi Rah 2
programme.desc: Located in the North Malé Atoll of Maldives, the Reethi Rah resort is the perfect combination of island life mixed with world-class luxury.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Viajar Mexico S2 Pátzcuaro
programme.desc: Charlie Rubio visits one of the many ‘indigenous paradises’ across Mexico, where he gets a chance to visit a hidden heron sanctuary on an island.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun

Lastly, Alex is seen exploring the Niagara falls by helicopter, the a tunnel that takes him to the observation desk and then by ferry.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: Flip through the pages of history as set out to explore and understand the architecture of islamic Monuments built right from 11th century in Delhi.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Food Fact Fun Vancouver Island, Canada
programme.desc: Alex is in Vancouver Island and calls for Saffron salmon at Modern Cafe. Next he visits “Red fish blue fish” a fish and chip shop and tries freshly prepared seafood. Further explores the Parksville beach for its sand sculptures and then explores a 50 year old Symphony Winery. Further Alex visits “Eagle wing whale watching” for fun and knowledge about the ocean life. To add to the adventure rush he tries motocross and then snorkels in cold waters of Nanaimo.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Unwind Park Hyatt, Maldives
programme.desc: Indeya Passfield seeks local Maldivian experiences in Hadahaa, where she learns about the ecosystem, local traditions and cuisine.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Viajar Mexico S2 Santiago
programme.desc: What began as an adventurous getaway in Santiago unexpectedly transforms into a spiritually moving experience for Charlie!

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Sabrina Chakici visits Manchester, the city of football and fashion, the city of heritage and hedonism, the city of the industrial revolution.

programme.title: Bliss
programme.desc: Most popular destinations of Santorini's main island are the volcano and the hot spring.This is best way to explore this island is on foot.

programme.title: Best From The Rest
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 Best From The Rest Hong Kong Top Sees
programme.desc: While Hong Kong may be a haven for social media brags, a closer look at some of its most iconic attractions exposes its authentic richness.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Food Fact Fun Whistler, Canada
programme.desc: Alex starts with Kangaroo meat pie in Whistler with a Australian ginger beer and continuing his food trail he visits Earls kitchen for a tuna dish. He then tries out e-biking and travels in the world’s highest cable car joining Blackcomb with Whistler mountain. Next, he visits Squamish lil’wat cultural center to learn about the Aboriginal people. Finally, he takes a tour of Pemberton valley on a horse, tries Canada’s highest zipline and bungee jumps over the Cheakamus river.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Unwind Banyan Tree, Maldives
programme.desc: Indeya unwinds at the Banyan Tree resort. She tries water sports, learns a traditional Maldivian recipe, rejuvenates herself at a spa and ends her day by exploring the capital city of Male.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Viajar Mexico S2 Cuatro Ciénegas
programme.desc: In Cuatro Ciénegas, Charlie finds himself uncovering the wonders of the destination, one more surreal than the other.

programme.title: XP Guide
programme.desc: Stockholm, the capital and largest city of Sweden, was built on 14 Islands. This place is also sometimes referred as Venice of the north.

programme.title: The Savvy Nomad
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Savvy Nomad Bangkok, Thailand (ENG)
programme.desc: From meeting the “Queen of Bangkok Street Food” to eating Pad Thai at the place where it was born, Emeline lives a foodie’s dream in Bangkok.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Food Fact Fun Montreal, Canada
programme.desc: Alex Drobin experiences the North American energy and European charm of Montreal as he explores all that the city has to offer.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Heather in Tenerife explores colonial buildings and later visits Santa Cruz de Tenerife, ending her day at San Andreas. Next day explores a zoological park and visits 1000+ year old Tree.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Viajar Mexico S2 Tlaquepaque
programme.desc: On the map of Mexico, Tlaquepaque looks like just another suburb of Guadalajara, but Charlie knows that there is more to this town than meets the eye.

programme.title: Xplore Sri Lanka
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Xplore Sri Lanka Colombo
programme.desc: At the monumental Lion Paws Gate of a 5th-century Sri Lankan fortress filled with centuries-old rock art, Mohit is ready to relive a bygone era.

programme.title: Xp Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E22 Xp Guide Oslo 1, Norway
programme.desc: With a rich history dating back to over 1000 years, Oslo’s iconic monuments reveal its evolution through the ages to visitors.

programme.title: The Savvy Nomad
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 The Savvy Nomad Lampung, Thailand (ENG)
programme.desc: At an elephant conservation centre in Lampang, Emeline experiences the immense love that the Thai people feel for their national animal.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Food Fact Fun Quebec, Canada
programme.desc: From the famous deer meat pie of Aux Ancies Canadiens to the art on Rue Du Tresor, Alex Drobin soaks in the vibes of sophisticated yet playful Quebec.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Heather tries Paella, Los Gigantes village and also the Pyramids of Guimar. She also enjoys stargazing atop El Teide and tries jet skiing at Playa del Duque, ending at Siam water park.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Viajar Mexico S2, Tequila
programme.desc: Charlie’s journey across his homeland brings him to the birthplace of tequila, the iconic Mexican spirit to understand what makes it irresistible.

programme.title: Xplore Sri Lanka
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Sri Lanka Kandy
programme.desc: On his very first visit to a Buddhist temple in the city of Kandy, Mohit witnesses one of the most important relics of Lord Buddha - his tooth!

programme.title: Xp Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E23 Xp Guide Oslo 2, Norway
programme.desc: During Elisha’s visit to Oslo, she finds herself in awe of the extraordinary well-designed ships used by the legendary Vikings of Norway.

programme.title: The Savvy Nomad
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Savvy Nomad Chiang Rai, Thailand (ENG)
programme.desc: While exploring the extraordinary temples in Chiang Rai, Emeline begins to uncover the stories hidden in their fascinating architecture.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Food Fact Fun Toronto, Canada
programme.desc: Alex Drobin gets to know the vibe of Toronto at significant spots such as Saint Lauren’s Market and Sir Henry’s Garage for Classic Cars.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Backpack Gran Canaria, Spain
programme.desc: Heather visits Casa De Colon museum, a rum cellar and then Puerto de Mogan. Later explores Maspalomas Dunes and wraps up after trying chestnut mousse.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Viajar Mexico S2 Bernal
programme.desc: From the towering Peña de Bernal monolith to the Queretaro wine region, Charlie visits some of Mexico’s lesser-known cultural gems.

programme.title: Xplore Sri Lanka
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Xplore Sri Lanka Galle
programme.desc: In the ancient city of Anuradhapura, home to the sapling of the tree under which Buddha attained enlightenment, Mohit finds deep bliss.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Great World Hotels One & Only Reethi Rah 2
programme.desc: Located in the North Malé Atoll of Maldives, the Reethi Rah resort is the perfect combination of island life mixed with world-class luxury.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Xplore Bulgaria Sunny Beach
programme.desc: Luxurious hotels, thrilling water parks, inexpensive food and almost 300 days of bright sunny weather make Bulgaria’s biggest seaside resort, Sunny Beach popular for budget beach getaways. Catriona, however, stumbles onto the historic town of Nessebar, which is over 3000 years old, and realizes that there is more to the place than meets the eye. She goes on to visit the Castra Rubra winery, where she finds out about the history of Viticulture in Bulgaria and the process of wine making.

programme.title: Kissed By The Sea
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Kissed By The Sea Mauritius 2
programme.desc: While exploring island life in Mauritius, Sakshi Pradhan tries out the third longest zipline in the world and sees the unique phenomenon of the 23 coloured Earth at Vallée des Couleurs. Following this, she takes a submarine ride and explores the passion of the locals for horse races. She also encounters tortoises and crocodiles at the Vanilla Crocodile Park.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 World Heritage Monuments of Cairo and Luxor, Egypt
programme.desc: While the Pyramids of Giza, built as a royal mortuary, reveal the religious beliefs of Egyptian pharaohs, temples, like the Luxor temple, offer a glimpse of ancient Egyptian mythology. The Saladin Citadel, which defines the skyline of Cairo, however, tells stories of the faith of Ottoman rulers. The monuments of Egypt are a testament to the different beliefs that have shaped this country.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: This exhilarating city of castles, beer and segway rides can take you on a break that will truly leave you catching your breath.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Viajar Mexico S2 Monterrey
programme.desc: In Monterrey, one of Mexico’s ‘Pueblo Magicos’, Charlie heads straight to a canyon, where the locals go to have ‘beer and barbecue’ picnics.

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Food Fact Fun Vancouver, Canada
programme.desc: Alex starts his Vancouver exploration by visiting Bridges restaurant where he tries smoked salmon pizza with some seafood. Then he visits the Richmond Night Market and then Treasure Cafe. Later visits the Steel Toad Brewery in Olympic Village. Next he explores the Gastown, including the steam clock. Further he explores the Hills Native Art ending with Vancouver observation deck. Next he rides on board the Grouse Mountain Skyride, ending with Capilano Suspension Bridge park.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Viajar Mexico S2 Monterrey
programme.desc: In Monterrey, one of Mexico’s ‘Pueblo Magicos’, Charlie heads straight to a canyon, where the locals go to have ‘beer and barbecue’ picnics.

programme.title: Xplore Bulgaria
programme.desc: For the people of Sofia, preserving its heritage is sacrosanct, and this can be seen in the way the city's infrastructure is built around its archeological treasures. Catriona realizes this when she roams around the cobblestone streets of the city. With every monument she visits, she finds herself transported to a different era, right from Perperikon fort, which narrate stories of the Byzantine empire, to Boyana church, which is home to some of the earliest examples of medieval artwork.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Unwind Park Hyatt, Maldives
programme.desc: Indeya Passfield seeks local Maldivian experiences in Hadahaa, where she learns about the ecosystem, local traditions and cuisine.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: Flip through the pages of history as set out to explore and understand the architecture of islamic Monuments built right from 11th century in Delhi.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.desc: Sabrina Chakici visits Manchester, the city of football and fashion, the city of heritage and hedonism, the city of the industrial revolution.

programme.title: Viajar Mexico S2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Viajar Mexico S2 Santiago
programme.desc: What began as an adventurous getaway in Santiago unexpectedly transforms into a spiritually moving experience for Charlie!

programme.title: Food Fact Fun
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Food Fact Fun Vancouver Island, Canada
programme.desc: Alex is in Vancouver Island and calls for Saffron salmon at Modern Cafe. Next he visits “Red fish blue fish” a fish and chip shop and tries freshly prepared seafood. Further explores the Parksville beach for its sand sculptures and then explores a 50 year old Symphony Winery. Further Alex visits “Eagle wing whale watching” for fun and knowledge about the ocean life. To add to the adventure rush he tries motocross and then snorkels in cold waters of Nanaimo.

programme.title: Jenson Button Revisits His Biggest Racing Moments - F1, WEC, NASCAR and more
programme.desc: Jenson Button, current Hertz Team JOTA WEC driver and former F1 World Champion shares never-before-heard details on his wild 2009 title run with Brawn, his final F1 race in Monaco while subbing in for Fernando Alonso, the terrifying truth about his malfunctioning helmet in 2004, and more.

programme.title: The 10 Best British F1 Drivers Of All Time
programme.desc: With the 70th Anniversary Grand Prix taking place at Silverstone this weekend, we thought we’d take a look at some of the greatest F1 drivers to ever come out of Great Britain.

programme.title: How the FIA Robbed Hamilton's 2008 Belgian GP Win
programme.desc: After an intense battle with Kimi Raikkonen, Lewis Hamilton put on an incredible performance to cross the finish line first at the 2008 Belgian Grand Prix. But he never won... In the latest of Autosport’s “Short View Back to the Past” series, Chief Editor Kevin Turner looks at when Hamilton was robbed at Spa.

programme.title: Top 10 Senna Moments
programme.desc: Qualifying performances from "another dimension"; thrashing his rivals repeatedly in torrential wet conditions; doing whatever it took to win the world championship at all costs. Ayrton Senna's too-brief time in Formula 1 was a colourful tapestry of brilliant driving and high-stakes controversy. On the 25th anniversary of his tragic crash at Imola, Autosport brings you the most unforgettable moments of the late Brazilian's F1 career.

programme.title: The Valentino Rossi Story
programme.desc: An extraordinary personality, global popularity, legendary victory celebrations, and nine motorcycle world championship titles - those are the words to describe Valentino Rossi.

programme.title: BRC 2025 - Round 4: Rallye De Wallonie
programme.desc: What a denouement. After Cédric Cherain dominated the race with the Porsche 992 Rally GT, the car suddenly stopped briefly on the Naninne dirt track due to an electronic fault. lost 2 minutes and Jos Verstappen did not miss the opportunity to score his third win of the season.

programme.title: F1's Fiercest Rivalries with Karun Chandhok
programme.desc: From the personal insults of Nigel Mansell vs Nelson Piquet, the short but fiery feud between Ayrton Senna and Michael Schumacher, to a friendship turned sour between Nico Rosberg and Lewis Hamilton, they’re all featured here. But what pair takes the Number 1 spot? Autosport Editor-In-Chief Kevin Turner sits down with former driver and Sky Sports F1 broadcaster Karun Chandhok to debate who they think are the Top 10 greatest rivalries in the sport’s 75-year history. programme.title: British GT 2025 | Round 4: Oulton Park
programme.desc: Watch the fourth round of the 2025 British GT Championship at Oulton Park.

programme.title: RDM 2024: Stage 3 Highlights
programme.desc: Catch all the highlights from the third stage of Rallye du Maroc.

programme.title: Giorgio Piola: Illustrating Speed
programme.desc: For nearly 50 years Giorgio Piola has been the foremost technical journalist in Formula 1. He has attended more Grands Prix than anyone in history. This film looks at the remarkable career of this legend.

programme.title: Michael Schumacher at Le Mans
programme.desc: In 1991, before his stellar F1 career, Michael Schumacher raced for Mercedes at Le Mans - and had a legitimate shot at winning the most prestigious endurance race in the World. Autosport Editor-in-Chief Kevin Turner narrates the story of this dramatic race, and explains how the lessons Schumacher learnt in these 900bhp cars shaped his career in F1, and assisted him in some of his most famous races.

programme.title: Carbon Fibre vs Liveries - What F1 Needs to Bring Colour Back
programme.desc: F1's 2024 season may have kicked off, but during the pre-season events, bare carbon fibre kept catching our eyes. It was an interesting novelty a few years ago, but in 2024, fans are missing the bright, colourful paint schemes of previous years. To understand more, Jon Noble chatted with Mark Turner, Co-Founder and CEO of Silverstone Paint Technology, who works with the majority of the F1 grid, to find out more.

programme.title: The Road to Success - Emil Frey Lexus Racing Team
programme.desc: Join the Emil Frey Lexus Racing Team as it tackles the world's toughest GT racing - the Blancpain GT Series. Go behind the scenes for all the action and emotion from the Swiss team with exclusive interviews and racing footage!

programme.title: TCR South America 2025 | Round 4: Termas de Río Hondo - Race 1
programme.desc: Watch race 1 of the fourth round of the 2025 TCR South America season at Termas de Río Hondo, Argentina.

programme.title: Climbing Up The Grid with Ayao Komatsu, Haas F1 Team Principal
programme.desc: Becoming Team Principal for Haas' F1 team this year, Ayao Komatsu came from an engineering background, a rather unusual route for a Team Principal but one that he believes gives him an important perspective while pushing Haas towards the front of the grid. Stuart Codling got together with Ayao Komatsu at his favourite rock climbing centre (yes, we mean rock climbing) Big Rock Climbing in Milton Keynes to chat about his career, why rock climbing is so important to him, and how he's leading Haas in climbing up the F1 grid.

programme.title: Why Lauda's Crash Led To F1's Greatest Ever Comeback
programme.desc: After suffering near-fatal injuries after his fiery crash during the 1976 German Grand Prix at the Nürburgring, Niki Lauda returned to racing just 6 weeks later. In the latest of Autosport’s “Short View Back to the Past” series, Chief Editor Kevin Turner turns his attention to F1’s greatest comeback. Which motorsport tale would you like us to cover next? Please let us know in the comments. #F1 #Formula1

programme.title: The 5 worst title defences in F1 history
programme.desc: While managing to successfully defend a Formula 1 world title is an incredibly difficult task, there have been several occasions in F1’s history where a failed title defence has been surprisingly poor. Autosport’s Technical Editor Jake Boxall-Legge has five such examples of drivers who not only failed to hit the heights of the championship year, but plummeted down the pecking order.

programme.title: Episode 6: Hellas Rally Raid and Monster Jam
programme.desc: Gearing Up is back with another thrilling episode that takes you on an exhilarating journey around the globe, showcasing the most unique and intense competitions the world has to offer. In this episode, high skills, a passion for technology, an impatience for innovation, and a pure love for adrenaline are combined at their best. Buckle up, rev your engines, and get ready for some electrifying action as you experience the thrill of full G-force! The episode kicks off with Hellas Rally Raid. The Hellas Rally Raid is an international off-road motorsports event held annually in the landscapes of Greece. Spanning 7 days, it challenges riders and drivers to navigate through hundreds of...

programme.title: TCR South America 2025 | Round 5: Mercedes - Race 1
programme.desc: Watch race 1 of the fifth round of the 2025 TCR South America season at Mercedes, Uruguay.

programme.title: From Wheelchair to Race Car - How Robert Wickens Overcame the Odds
programme.desc: In 2018, a horrific crash at Pocono nearly ended Robert Wickens’ life—and seemingly ended his racing career. He suffered a double spinal cord fracture, multiple broken bones, and a severe pulmonary contusion. By the end of that year, Robert revealed he was a paraplegic. But Robert Wickens is not like most people. This is the story of a man who refused to be defined by the crash that changed everything. Through unwavering determination, incredible resilience, and the cutting-edge technology of Bosch Motorsport, Robert set his sights on an unthinkable goal: to race again at the highest level. This isn’t just a story about recovery—it's about rediscovery. About holding onto your...

programme.title: Le Mans Classic 2025
programme.desc: Step back in time at Le Mans Classic, where we meet legendary race drivers and passionate car collectors to explore the enduring legacy of vintage machines. From the roaring icons of 1923 to the sleek speedsters of the ’90s, experience the full spectrum of historic racing — on and off the track.

programme.title: 2 + 4 = 24 documentary
programme.desc: 1 Rider. 1 Driver. 2 Races - each over 24 hours. 24 hours are always tough, no matter where you do it. Australian bike rider Josh Hook on Honda Fireblade and Portuguese racing driver Tiago Monteiro on Honda Civic Type R walk us through the challenging endurance races in detail and answer the question: what is it like to be a 2-wheel and 4-wheel race gladiator? Follow Josh Hook and Tiago Monteiro to the edges of hell and back in the two toughest 24 Hour races of 2020: 24 Hours of Nurburgring and 24 Heures Motos at Le Mans.

programme.title: Motorsport Images: An Enduring Legacy
programme.desc: 26 million images. 100 years of racing. This is the story of Motorsport Images, the premiere photographic agency and archive covering motorsport and motoring. It is unique in that it provides photography of all major current motorsport events, from Formula One Grand Prix racing to national level racing, as well as archive images documenting the history of the sport dating back to 1895.

programme.title: BRX 2025: Rounds 1 -2 -3: Review
programme.desc: Take a look at the first three rounds of the 2025 Belgian Rallycross Championship.

programme.title: Road to 2026, Episode 1: The Journey So Far
programme.desc: Before looking to the future and 2026's regulation changes, first we must look back at the past. In episode one of our new Road to 2026 series with PETRONAS Motorsports we look at the history of the partnership, the origin of hybrid technology in F1, and how, together, we've pushed the boundaries of innovation.

programme.title: The Top 10 Red Bull F1 Drivers - Part 1
programme.desc: Red Bull is much younger than Formula 1’s other big teams, having arrived in 2005. But in less than two decades it has racked up some impressive achievements. Six drivers’ and five constructors’ titles headline a CV that includes 92 world championship grand prix wins, enough for sixth on the all-time list behind Ferrari, McLaren, Mercedes, Williams and Lotus. For this list of top 10 F1 drivers, we’ve taken into account the amount of success the racers scored with Red Bull and its sister team Toro Rosso/AlphaTauri, the impact they had and the circumstances of their time within the Red Bull fold. Want to know more about our top 10 or hear experts debate the list? Take a look here: ...

Want to know more about our top 10 or hear experts debate the list? Take a look here: ...

programme.title: 4 Things We'd Change To Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya | Formula 1
programme.desc: How do you fix the Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya? Was the new Turn 10 any better? And is it a completely boring circuit? Spanish GP races are usually a snoozefest, and despite Mercedes' exciting strategic win, the 2021 GP wasn't much better. But why is that? Jake Boxall-Legge has 4 ways the circuit could improve, whether the new Turn 10 saved the day, and how Formula 1 drivers could benefit from circuit upgrades.

programme.title: The banned Lotus that wasn't actually very good
programme.desc: The twin-chassis Lotus 88 is considered the last truly ground-breaking design attempted by Colin Chapman, but we never found out how fast it could have been because it was never allowed to race. However, as Giorgio Piola reveals, while rivals feared the concept, its drivers were not convinced the 88 would have delivered on the track. How did it work? Jake Boxall-Legge guides you through Chapman's complex idea to make ground effect cars more user-friendly.

programme.title: 8 F1 drivers who only started one grand prix
programme.desc: Drivers only making one Formula 1 start in their career are a rare breed, and quite often those who appear just once have an interesting story behind their fleeting presence on the F1 grid. Jake Boxall-Legge takes a look back through history to pick out eight varied stories about one-time F1 starters - some you may remember better than others. And we finish off our trip down memory lane paying our respects to a man who only made this list because tragedy intervened...

programme.title: Golden Fly Series Genf (SUI) 2024 - Part 1
programme.desc: Geneva will host the Golden Fly Series 2024 athletics spectacle for the first time! On Saturday 21 Sep, the world's best long jumpers and pole vaulters will be competing for important world ranking points on the largest mobile World Athletics-certified athletics facility in the world.

programme.title: Beni SpeedTransalp
programme.desc: For this route from Ruhpolding (GER) to Kasern (ITA), 210 kilometers and more than 10000 meters of vert, recreational athletes need approximately five to seven days. Benedikt Boehm is aiming for the magic time limit of 36 hours, non-stop.

programme.title: Mammut Athlete Profile - Ildiko Wermescher
programme.desc: Ultramarathon, also called ultra distance, is any sporting event involving running and walking further than in traditional 42 kilometer marathon. The Mammut athlete Ildiko Wermerscher reflects us her inspiration and motivation for this extreme sport.

programme.title: GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024 – Ibiraquera (BRA) – Overall Highlights
programme.desc: Ibiraquera is the venue for the GKA Kite-Surf World Cup 2024, which brings together the best kitesurfers in the world. Athletes from all over the world will compete for the title and show impressive skills in surfing and strapless freestyle.

programme.title: Inside Surfing Ep.6
programme.desc: Inside Surfing tells the stories about the people, places and things that make surfing so special. Is it a sport, an art form or a lifestyle, or all three at the same time? The series provides a look behind the scenes of surfing with all its facets.

programme.title: LINE OF SIGHT | A Look into Wingsuit BASE Jumping
programme.desc: The golden age of wingsuiting is upon us. Through evolving suit technology the initial inflation time has gone down, which has lead to quicker starts and more exits. Wingsuit athletes Marshal Miller, Jesse Hall, and Sean Chuma take you through the iconic jumps.

programme.title: THE RIO CAQUETA
programme.desc: Jules Domine and Tyler Bradt, obsessed and addicted to whitewater adventure, make a plan to journey the long way, from the source of Rio Caqueta 1,000 Kilometers downstream to an unreal big water canyon deep in the Colombian Amazon.

programme.title: A Plea For Refuge
programme.desc: Two adventurous friends, Jeff Shapiro and Cody Tuttle, have a desire to experience one of the last, raw, and truly preserved wilderness areas on the North American continent, attempt to hike and fly paraglider's across the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge in Alaska.

programme.title: WHY WE FLY
programme.desc: Ever wondered what goes through someone’s mind as they jump from a helicopter above the Canadian Rockies? Then ride along with the Team KAVU athletes as they wingsuit, skydive, and speedride above scenic Fernie, British Columbia.

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: This adventure from the Edge of the World tells the amazing story of the crew of Polish yacht “Selma Expeditions”, and their voyage to the most challenging waters in the world. 11 crewmembers take on the heroic challenge of reaching The Bay of Whales in the Antarctic.

programme.title: GWA Wingfoil World Cup - Sal (CPV)
programme.desc: Sal is the venue for the GWA Wingfoil World Cup 2024, where the best wingfoilers in the world will meet for an exciting competition. This paradise in Cape Verde is known for its strong winds and rolling Atlantic waves.
